Class MillipedeGame

java.lang.Object
  MillipedeGame

public class MillipedeGame
extends Object

This class will play the Millipede arcade game.

Nested Class Summary
private  class MillipedeGame.Control
          This class is the control class for all of the user input via the keyboard
static class MillipedeGame.PlayState
          enum which controls whether the simulation is playing, paused, or exiting
private static class MillipedeGame.saveState
          controls whether or not the to save the images every 50 iterations or not

public static int MillipedeStartSize
Starting size of Millipedes. This number will increase fast with each additional level

public static int OBSTACLES_START
Number of Obstacles to start with

private int iteration
Iteration counter

highscores

private JList highscores
This maintains the list of the highscores that are displayed

allScores

private PriorityQueue<ScoreData> allScores
This PriorityQueue holds all of the scores on the game that have been saved. It is sorted based on score from high to low

path

private static final String path
This is the path to the file where the HighScores are saved

See Also:
Constant Field Values
Constructor Detail

MillipedeGame

public MillipedeGame(int width,
                     int height)
Constructor for the Millipede game. This will start the game with a landscape of the given width, height. It will also start the game initially paused and not saving images. The user starts with START_LIVES number of lives and with MillipedeStartSize number of Millipedes

Parameters:
width - - width of the landscape
height - - height of the landscape
Method Detail

initializeObstacles

public void initializeObstacles(int numObstacles)
This method initializes the obstacles onto the landscape, they will spawn in random, integer locations across the board they do not span in the bottom 1/5 of the board (where the defender is). They will also not spawn near the Defenders start location

Parameters:
numObstacles - - number of obstacles to create

initializeMillipede

public void initializeMillipede(int size)
This method will initialize the Millipede onto the landscape. Initially it will be entirely off of the landscape and then come on the top left row.

Parameters:
size - - size of the Initial millipede to create

initializeDefender

public void initializeDefender()
This method will initialize a new defender on the landscape at the given X_START, Y_START positions

setupUI

private void setupUI()
This method sets up the User interface with the buttons and the text that is displayed outside of the landscape in the display

updateTotals

public void updateTotals()
This method will update the score display in the display

updateScores

public String[] updateScores(String path)
This method will get the new top 6 high scores and return them as an array of Strings. The first string will be "HighScores"

Parameters:
path - - full path to the HighScores data txt file
Returns:
returns an array of the top 5 scores, length 6, with the first element being the string "HighScores"

createNewScoreFile

public void createNewScoreFile(String path)
This method will create new source file for the highScores data. If the file already exists and this method is called it will be overwritten

Parameters:
path - - full pathname to the file to be created

addScore

public void addScore(String path,
                     String user,
                     int score)
This method will save a new High score to the file

Parameters:
path - - full pathname to the highscore path file
user - - string that is the user's name
score - - score that the user got

loadScores

public void loadScores(String path)
This method will load all of the scores in the text file into a sorted PriorityQueue. each score will be saved as a SaveData class which holds the name and the score.

Parameters:
path - - full pathname to the txt file holding the high scores

iterate

public void iterate()
This method will iterate the game by one iteration. It will handle what to do if the game ends, a defender dies, and if the level is complete.

defenderDied

public void defenderDied()
This method handles the case where the defender has died during play If the user has lives left, it will decrement the lives and reset the Defender to the starting position.

If the user does not have lives left it will pause the game so that the user can look at his score/level and so on. It will also turn the pauseButton into a Restart button. The user can then restart the game from level 0 with a score of 0

reset

public void reset()
This method will reset the game. It will not reset the level or number of lives left. This method is used for starting the next level

reStart

public void reStart()
This method will restart the game from the begining

repaint

public void repaint()
This method repaints the display

printUsage

private static void printUsage()
This method will print the usage of the MillipedeGame main function to the terminal. The usage looks as follows:

Usage: MillipedeGame [-w,--width] [-h, --height] [-l, --lives] [-m, --millipede] [-o, --obstacles]

main

public static void main(String[] args)
This method runs the Millipede Game

Parameters:
args - - optional input of the width(w), height(w), number of lives (l), size of initial millipede (m), and the number of obstacles on the landscape (o). See printUsage method for usage of this method
